alert.note: Alert for Acadia (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued October 25 at 5:17AM CDT until October 25 at 5:45AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Acadia Parish in southwestern Louisiana... * Until 545 AM CDT. * At 516 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Richard, or near Church Point, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Acadia Parish. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
